==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ふた|り|yomi=k}}

===Etymology===
Native Japanese, written with the kanji [[二]] ("two") + [[人]] ("person").

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ふたり|ににん}}

# two people
#: {{ja-usex|二人の女の子が寝ています。|ふたり の おんなのこ が ねています。|Two girls are sleeping.}}
# a [[couple]] (two partners), they
#: {{ja-usex|二人で暮らす|ふたり で くらす|to live as a couple}}
# {{lb|ja|poetic|sort=ふたり}} the two of us, we

===Usage notes===
The reading [[ににん]] is only used in compounds (e.g. [[二人称]]) in modern Japanese.
